global_governance.escalation_policy: Failure at any section -> escalate to supervisor

validation_criteria.level_coverage: All six Bloom's levels (Remember, Understand, Apply, Analyze, Evaluate, Create) must be assessable
validation_criteria.classification_consistency: Repeated assessment of equivalent evidence must yield the same cognitive level
validation_criteria.boundary_discrimination: Adjacent levels must be distinguishable by defined verb/evidence markers
validation_criteria.dok_alignment: Depth of Knowledge ratings must correlate positively with Bloom's level assignments

sections.description: Framework defining how to classify learning outcomes according to Bloom's Revised Taxonomy cognitive levels, from Remember through Create.

validation_criteria.structural_coverage: All five SOLO levels (Pre-structural, Unistructural, Multistructural, Relational, Extended Abstract) must be distinguishable
validation_criteria.response_mapping: Learner evidence must map to exactly one SOLO level per assessment instance
validation_criteria.progression_coherence: Detected structural level must be consistent with observed relational integration
validation_criteria.inter_rater_reliability: Structural classification must achieve acceptable agreement across repeated evaluations

sections.description: Framework defining how to analyze learner response structure using Biggs' SOLO (Structure of Observed Learning Outcomes) taxonomy, from pre-structural through extended abstract.

validation_criteria.dimension_coverage: All six Fink dimensions must be assessable independently
validation_criteria.significance_scoring: Each dimension must yield a quantifiable significance score
validation_criteria.synergy_detection: Cross-dimensional synergies must be identifiable when multiple dimensions co-activate
validation_criteria.holistic_integration: The combined profile must produce a coherent significance narrative beyond individual scores

sections.description: Framework defining how to evaluate learning significance across Fink's six dimensions: Foundational Knowledge, Application, Integration, Human Dimension, Caring, and Learning How to Learn.

sections.section_name: Gagné's Events of Instruction Alignment Framework

validation_criteria.event_coverage: All nine instructional events must be evaluable for alignment
validation_criteria.sequence_integrity: Event activation must follow the prescribed sequential order
validation_criteria.processing_verification: Learner evidence must confirm internal processing at each event stage
validation_criteria.gap_identification: Missing or weak event activations must be flagged with remediation signals

sections.description: Framework defining how to evaluate whether learning outcomes align with Gagné's Nine Events of Instruction, assessing whether instructional processing conditions were met during the learning episode.

validation_criteria.phase_identification: All four Kolb phases must be identifiable from learner evidence
validation_criteria.cycle_completeness: Assessment must detect whether a full cycle has been traversed
validation_criteria.phase_balance: Over-reliance on a single phase must be flagged as a learning style imbalance
validation_criteria.progression_tracking: Movement between phases must be temporally sequenced and verifiable

sections.description: Framework defining how to identify and assess a learner's position within Kolb's four-phase experiential learning cycle: Concrete Experience, Reflective Observation, Abstract Conceptualisation, and Active Experimentation.

validation_criteria.stage_discrimination: All five Dreyfus stages must be distinguishable through observable indicators
validation_criteria.indicator_alignment: Observed performance must match the defining characteristics of the assigned stage
validation_criteria.progression_validity: Stage progression must be monotonic within a skill domain over sufficient time
validation_criteria.contextual_sensitivity: Higher stages must demonstrate increasing context-dependent (non-rule-based) behaviour

sections.description: Framework defining how to assess a learner's proficiency stage within the Dreyfus model: Novice, Advanced Beginner, Competent, Proficient, and Expert.

validation_criteria.level_coverage: All seven Simpson levels must be assessable
validation_criteria.motor_evidence_mapping: Performance evidence must map to specific psychomotor indicators at each level
validation_criteria.progression_sequence: Higher levels must demonstrate fluency, automaticity, and creative adaptation beyond mechanical accuracy
validation_criteria.embodied_assessment: Evaluation must accommodate non-verbal, performance-based evidence modalities

sections.description: Framework defining how to assess psychomotor skill development across Simpson's seven levels: Perception, Set, Guided Response, Mechanism, Complex Overt Response, Adaptation, and Origination.

validation_criteria.taxonomy_coverage: Synthesis must incorporate outputs from all seven preceding constructs
validation_criteria.conflict_resolution: Contradictory signals across taxonomies must be detected and reconciled with documented rationale
validation_criteria.dimensional_weighting: Weighting scheme must be context-sensitive and justifiable based on learning objectives
validation_criteria.profile_coherence: Final synthesis profile must be internally consistent and actionable
validation_criteria.metacognitive_integration: Metacognitive reflection signals must inform the overall synthesis

sections.description: Framework defining how to synthesise assessment results from all preceding single-taxonomy constructs (K-HOA-0 through K-HOA-6) into a unified, multi-dimensional learner outcome profile.

validation_criteria.evidence_grounding: Every feedback statement must be traceable to specific assessment evidence
validation_criteria.actionability: Feedback must contain concrete next-step recommendations, not just evaluative labels
validation_criteria.routing_correctness: Feedback signals must reach the correct target agent or learner channel
validation_criteria.feedback_level_coverage: Feedback must address task, process, and self-regulation levels where evidence supports it
validation_criteria.longitudinal_tracking: Feedback routing must support longitudinal evidence accumulation

sections.description: Framework defining how to generate targeted feedback based on the synthesised outcome profile and route it to the appropriate downstream agents and learner-facing channels.

validation_criteria.completeness_check: Handoff bundle must contain all required fields per the L06→L07/L08/MP data contracts
validation_criteria.provenance_integrity: Every assessment claim must have a traceable evidence chain back to source atoms
validation_criteria.multimodal_packaging: All modality-specific artefacts (text, visual, performance) must be correctly encoded and referenced
validation_criteria.contract_compliance: Output schema must pass validation against downstream consumer expectations
validation_criteria.audit_readiness: Bundle must be MP06-auditable without additional transformation

sections.description: Framework defining how to compile the complete assessment artefact package for handoff to downstream layers (L07 HICE, L08 SFE) and governance metaprocesses (MP01-MP06), ensuring all required data contracts are satisfied.

This construct provides guardrails for L06 agents (LAA, MRA, OFR) when processing student-set objectives. It validates whether a stated objective type is appropriate for the learner's temporal context and provides guidance on classification, reclassification, and assessment validity.
